I don't see why you think this is special. If I hated Squad and KSP I wouldn't be bothering to post here, show off what I do in the game on occasion, or be a part of this community; it wouldn't be worth my time.
From my perspective Squad is just colossally bad at having an actual plan, are terribly bad at communicating in part because they have no actual plan, and are duct-taping tired game mechanic memes together in the hopes of making a coherent game after hitting it out of the ballpark with an incredible basic idea for a game. They're starting to fix some deep problems that the game has had for a long time and adding some badly needed realistic features, and if they can actually fix their memory leaks and write a proper asset manager to help 32-bit computers they'll have a pretty good game. In truth they're looking a lot better now than they did last year, but they still have a long way to go, and I don't entirely trust them to continue development beyond an update past 1.0.

If you take the above paragraph as "hate" then I question your critical thinking skills and ask that you take off the fanboy blinders. I am continually amazed that people around here don't bother trying to comprehend what a post is actually about (for certain, we're all guilty of that).

I went and looked at some pictures of the real Valentina, and there something about Valentina Kerbal that catches that look. It's subtle, but when you look at pictures of her contemporaries, people such as Yuri and Alexei, there aren't huge differences except for the shape of the face in the helmet.

And you can say much the same for the women pioneers in aviation generally, such as Amy Johnson, and the motorcyclists of the same era. There was a certain bias in the formal photography, but they were not like models or film stars, and they were known for what they did rather than for a pretty face.

> 
> Historical footnote: as kids, HarvesteR and his twin brother Moach used to play with matchstick astronauts from a race they named Kermans. "Kerbal" is the adjective form of Kerman, and that is the name players adopted for the creatures themselves, so it stuck. Thus, Kerman is not actually a surname. ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif) It's the race's name, just as ours is "human."

https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/33400-First-Flight?p=1072196&viewfull=1#post1072196

It all gets explained here. ![:wink:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

> 
> Be advised to read from the beginning after checking the paragraph concerning the name Kerman, this has become my main source as a Kerbal background story.
> 
> In KSK's First Flight storyline the word Kerman comes from Kerm-an, *translatable* into "outside the Kerm" - a Kerm being a *sentient tree* influencing the land of a Grove, the natural symbiotic form of a Kerbal community. Those leaving their Grove traditionally still call themselves Kerman.
